website_summaries.verdict: This trolley is solidly built at a good price, and it comes with a lot of extras.
pros: Comes with two 5-foot bungee cords and a 12-foot tie-down strap
Your choice of 2 different kickstand configurations
Good quality at a decent price
cons: Wheels don't easily come off, so it doesn't break down quite as completely for storage as other models
Strap works well for kayaks, but is too short for canoes

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sister and she was blown away. Super easy to setup, and love the fact that it has a kickstand! Taking her kayak around is now insanely easy, regardless of how far you have to walk it to the water from your vehicle. Very light too. Highly recommend, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Great cart! None of the competitors' deficiencies!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Unlike its competitors, its tires don't stink, and since they're solid, they can't go flat. Also unlike its competitors, it doesn't have a flimsy strap. Instead, it has both a strap and a bungee cord, both of which are long enough and of good quality. Finally, it's sturdy and doesn't keep trying to snap shut; and the boat fits very securely on it (no sliding around), even when not secured by the strap and/or the bungee cord. The designers got this one right!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great kayak carrier
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kayak carrier, it's the right size and seems to be of fairly good quality. The tires are airless, but squishy enough to provide a good grip when transporting.It disassembles and reassembles easily. I'd recommend and I'd buy it again. Can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Q

customer_reviews.title: This cart really works
customer_reviews.text: This just simply works great. I have used the cart for my canoe and for my three kayaks to move them from my garage to launching them, On a smooth surface, you can get by without strapping the canoe/kayak to the cart, but when you need to cross any obstruction, you need to remember to use the straps. Then, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: P.o.S.
customer_reviews.text: Worst item I ever bought on Amazon. Kayak won't stay on dolley with bungees or the strap provided. Don't waist your money on this piece of crap!!! Better off carrying kayak on your back!!! Even though I already knew how to use dolley, I went on YouTube to see if they had any suggestions. Did not help. It takes longer and hurts your back more to try and use this piece of junk!!! At least I learned a lesson so it wasn't a TOTAL waist of money!!! 😏
customer_reviews.author: cjb63

customer_reviews.title: Unfounded negative reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and it certainly seems well constructed. I cannot see how it could possibly fold up under use, as it snaps into place quite nicely. I haven't put my kayak on it yet, but it seems quite solid and very aesthetically pleasing. I will put my boat on it and pull it up and down my bumpy dirt driveway and let you all know.. First impression is that it looks well made and very functional.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E McAllister

customer_reviews.title: This is your carrier
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research. Great but. Aluminum frame so no rust. Comes assembled and packs very easy. Tested it in 4" sand and it rolled a 10' Kayak easily. Only draw back is the directions on tie down. Your kayak will slip out if you simply wrap the bungy or tie down. It need to be clasped to the frame. Simply double the bungy around the cargo frame and then hook both ends to the inner rib of the Kayak. Same for other side. Simple wrapping as instructed and your boat will slip out withing 10 feet of pulling. Other than that five stars. And price is spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product but it's weight capacity is overstated
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product but it's weight capacity is overstated. It is not meant for anything heavier than a standard kayak. My flycraft inflatable raft is too much for it to handle. It folded unless I emptied the boat of all gear...and used only on a level, hard surface. Also...there is no place on it to secure the lashing strap (s). You have to wind it around the bars and then around the boat. All this said...it's my fault for not getting a heavier duty caddy. This would be ideal for a lighter craft...but they are guilty of exaggerating it's capacity
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Moran

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR ANY ROCKY or ROOTED TRAIL
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY disappointed with this product.Unless you are using this on flat path or road,DO NOT BUY this.I tried going down a rocky,wooded trail and ,as some other reviewers experienced, my canoe came off multiple times.The unit folded up while pulling it.I tried a few different ways to secure the canoe ,none worked.I ended up carrying the canoe AND THE WHEELED CART to my destination and back.Ground clearance on this cart is VERY LOW.Will not roll over rocks or roots and collapsed MULTIPLE TIMES with any serious pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maiden voyage went well(ish) I do like this cart for my sit-inside Old Town fishing kayak
customer_reviews.text: Maiden voyage went well(ish) I do like this cart for my sit-inside Old Town fishing kayak, however, the cart kept falling off the boat when I was attempting to pull it through my yard on grass to get to my car to load. Once I was at the lake and on pavement the cart worked wonderfully! No complaints. When I got home and attempted to pull the boat through the grass in my backyard it fell off, again. I found if I push the boat and cart through the grass its fine, pulling does not work. Nice cart, lightweight, easy to install, just trouble through mowed grass.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolina

customer_reviews.title: If you have a kayak you need this
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Kayak carrier, just wrap the strap around the front metal bars of the carrier and you're good to go. I purchased this because it's no fun hauling around a 68-pound kayak alone. Good price and does the job. Spray painted the wheels black because I dislike the color yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, lightweight, with excellent "no-flat" tires
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made accessory for kayaks. It folds/unfolds a bit like a bicycle "kickstand," which makes it easy to grab-and-go when you're ready to roll your kayak to the shore or launch. Heavy-duty materials, including really solid tires (not filled with air, so they won't go flat). Comes with web straps for attaching kayak to the cart, but I'm using a heavy-duty bungee for simpler attachment, and seems to be fine. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph B

customer_reviews.title: Love this trolly cart
customer_reviews.text: Love this trolly cart! I bought it for my 12' kayak, and I am loathe to go without it. Makes transporting so much easier. Love that the wheels are solid and not inflatable. I've been over all kinds of terrain and nothing stops it. It's small enough that I can fold it up and strap it to my kayak when I put in, which means I can park farther away from my put in point and not worry about carrying a heavy kayak around.
customer_reviews.author: SKL718

customer_reviews.title: I like the way it folds and the wheels are easily ...
customer_reviews.text: Well built kayak cart. I like the way it folds and the wheels are easily removed to store in the kayak or store at home. The wheels fit all types of kayaks. Once the kayak becomes wet the wheels must be secured with a ratchet strap or they will slide off as the kayak is pulled.
customer_reviews.author: William Tyjewski

customer_reviews.title: Great buy !
customer_reviews.text: Wow ! What a difference ! I have a 16 foot kayak that is pretty heavy. This works great ! I have read a lot of reviews about the dolly folding when pulled through rougher terrain. The issue is easily resolved by using two straps ! One strap tied around the front support then around the kayak, and one strap tied to the rear support and around the kayak. ( It comes with two straps- use them ! ) Also, my kayak overhangs the long bed of my two door pickup truck, so I leave the wheels mounted on the kayak during transport..
customer_reviews.author: Patricia J. Small

customer_reviews.title: Super Great Carrier!!
customer_reviews.text: This Is a Great Back And Shoulder Saver For Your Kayak (Or Canoe). I’m 5’2” And My Equinox Kayak Is HEAVY For Me To Transport, So This Product Makes It Sooooo Much Easier To Get It From The Car To The Water And Back. My Only Regret Was That I Didn’t Get One Sooner! There Are No Instructions, But You Can Watch a Hundred YouTube Videos To Learn The Proper Way To Secure Your Kayak To This Trolley With No Problems. Seriously, You Won’t Regret Your Purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond Heart

customer_reviews.title: Useful cart for moving my kayak, but takes some time to find best way to secure it
customer_reviews.text: This cart is handy for moving my large 2-man kayak down to the lake from my house. The only issue is if it's not very securely attached, it tends to fold up when rolling on a bumpy surface. I found that ratchet straps do a better job of quickly securing it than the cords and straps included with the cart.
customer_reviews.author: HokieFan

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: The features I do like are it’s light weight seems sturdy should last a long time.Takes five seconds to assemble. The dislikes is how it folds up it does not snap in the place more like slips in the place. The directions are not very well thought out if you look at the picture you could see a problem all boats taper at the rear so if you hit something or something bogs down the dolly it will just simply push out of the straps which is Where are most of your time will be spent trying to secure your boat. Rubber tires would have been best rather than plastic tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for days we decide to go kayaking solo. We tried it out and it does the job! The only thing that I think is a hassle is getting the rachets tied on. We experminted and found out just tying one rachet does the job. I wish there was a little pouch or something that holds all the straps in when we aren't using it. But that's not super important. Tires work fine, kick stand is super helpful. See photos attached!
customer_reviews.author: Hakka Nein

customer_reviews.title: Kickstand kicks DOWN, not UP, so if you need more than 1" of ground clearance...
customer_reviews.text: Two things. 1) The directions are very average, Plenty of space for larger pictures and closeups. A link to a video would be nice as well. (see mine for a mote detailed review). 2) The kickstand does NOT kick up, it kicks back, which leaves you all of 1" of ground clearance. Major design flaw. Better to just leave the kickstand "up" in it's normal "down" position. Other than that, looks like a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for its price
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people pay up and get a C-TUG. I personally was not willing to spend the cash on that. This thing isn't amazing, but for the price I don't think you can beat it. Its biggest problem is that it folds up on itself under heavy load and bad angles. I see a lot of these cheaper ones suffer from that. It seems like some kind of locking mechanism once its open wouldn't be too hard to engineer (for an engineer). I used this to haul my 70lb kayak up a rocky dirt road 100yards. Yeah it collapsed on itself a couple times, but I made it. And I only spent $40 on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R.

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle heavy kayaks or terrain
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to keep attached to boat, a perception pedal kayak or any large open water kayak does not fit the design of this generic frame. Also, mostly useless in sand; There should be preset attachment points to make ease of tie-down and transport but a great big fail on the design. Poorly made with cheep and fragile plastic parts. Tried to return but vendor wants a bunch of photos and wants to replace with another useless unit. I will simple leave on the beach for other fool to pick-up.
customer_reviews.author: MILTON MADDEN

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This works great and I have gotten used to it. So much easier to move a 2person kayak now. Can take the kids out without having to find another adult to help carry (which was still not easy). It took some time to get the tying process down, but it works great once you get it. Really have to crank those straps tight or it falls right off.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I enjoy our canoe but he's been unable to lift it to put on the truck due to a back injury. I have chronic back issues so I am not able to help him. I ordered this cart hoping that we could start using our canoe again and enjoy all the beautiful springs we have in North Florida. It was so easy to assemble and a breeze to use. I can even pull on the canoe when it's on this cart! It's also small enough that we don't have to take it apart and can just place it inside the canoe until we are off the water again. Great purchase, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa CoreyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work well
customer_reviews.text: This cart will not hold my Ocean Kayak in place for more than a minute. Less if I am going over bumpy terrain. The straps pretty much suck, so I am going to have to get a better set. I think a better set of straps will make this work for me, but I shouldn't have to invest in a better set. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: SCSSTEVE

customer_reviews.title: Turns and bumps and your kayak is falling off
customer_reviews.text: With or without the straps my kayaks fall off if I hit a bump or take a turn. I have 2 different types of kayaks a sit inside and sit on top fishing kayak both are 10 feet long and same problem. Almost more trouble lugging this carrier around.
customer_reviews.author: Ni

customer_reviews.title: bomb dot com
customer_reviews.text: haha love this thing. I walk about 10 mins to the river to us my kayak. simple and easy. i even cheated the system a little. I stack my girlfriends kayak on top of mine that is secure to the wheels. again simple and easy. walked multiple times like this and its a beast. very easy to put together and keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Scott O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Makes toting easy.
customer_reviews.text: I really like my cart. As long as you set the kayak in it so the wheels face in -so they always face the middle of the kayak, I have not had any issues with it folding up. I also watched a video on you tube for strapping it down securely. I agree with other reviews that getting straps that ratchet will help so the don’t loosen. In my area, I don’t have to go over rough terrain just some sand and gravel. Suits my need just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself some time by watching a YouTube video or two on the subject. Always use the straps and the video will show how to properly attach. Otherwise, the cart will collapse and frustrate you. Strapped correctly, your kayak will be stable and secure. Haven't had to travel far, probably less than 100 yards per trip, but am quite pleased. Saves a lot of steps and back strain.
customer_reviews.author: Archer2010

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough - Left Slightly Wanting
customer_reviews.text: I really wish it had straps that actually attached to the cart. Separate crank straps are cumbersome but needed to keep the boat in place when moving. Kinda sucks but the price is what it is. Don't use bungees. Used it on 5+ camping-kayak trips. Left me wanting but will deal with it for a few years before upgrading to C-TUG
customer_reviews.author: ADudeW/NoMeans

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice cart for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice cart for the money. I have a Hobie outback kayak that weighs over 100lbs loaded and this cart worked perfectly fine moving it. I like that the tires are solid and don't require inflating as I've had issues with the standard type tires losing air over time. The wheels easily can come off by pulling the pins and the whole unit fits easily into my front hatch. Overall a good quality product I would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: M. Masters

customer_reviews.title: Great for the  money
customer_reviews.text: Love this, works great and if you position it as close to center as possible it makes the kayak almost weightless. I found you must use both straps and go up and over it will be very secure. Also found it was much easier and stable to push the kayak instead of pulling it. We use them on a trail of about a 1/4 mile of various surfaces , it goes over tree roots nicely and handles the sand equally well. PPM
customer_reviews.author: kayaker

customer_reviews.title: Bad for wider kayaks
customer_reviews.text: Seemed solid but very very hard to position and keep in position. Likes to collapse on itself at inopportune times. Got some nice fresh scratches in my boat thanks to this cart.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Best of this style of cart!
customer_reviews.text: Of the carts of this style, this one is definitely the best. I purchased another brand recently in haste, and quickly discovered they're not all the same! This cart uses larger diameter tubing, and the fit and finish is superior. I am not speaking only of cosmetics there; the lack of forming defects, and cleanly drilled holes will certainly allow more load. The only reason I would not rate it 5 stars, is the strap provided is a joke; you WILL need ratchet straps, so why bother? Also, the tires are suited for mowed lawns and parking lots, but that's fine for most people.
customer_reviews.author: E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: NO PUMPING TIRES!
customer_reviews.text: It's already time consuming to prep for a kayak ride, but not having to pump up tires on my cart is a plus. It easy, durable and affordable. I use it to walk down to the lake regularly.
customer_reviews.author: aj terrell

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this item once but have been happy with it so far. It appears and feels to be well constructed which is very important to me. I rolled my kayak (120 lbs) over some rough terrain and it handled well. It’s also light weight enough that I keep the cart attached to my kayak while transporting the yak in my truck bed. I just make sure the straps are tight enough. The straps come with a ratchet. I had to add some foam to the contact area because the existing foam pads aren’t big enough and the exposed bar contacts my yak. Other than that I’m very happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Mario R.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around quite a bit before finally settling on this cart. I even considered making my own from PVC. I was worried about durability and how effectively it can carry our 10'6" SOT kayak. Long story short, this cart is fantastic. There are no issues with the clips holding the wheels in place. This definitely makes transportation so much easier and was well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo DLR

customer_reviews.title: The Kayak carrier works as advertised, very lightweight and an exceptional value.
customer_reviews.text: I use the carrier to transport an Epic V7 plastic surfski (53 pounds). Effortless to transport the boat over hard surfaces and packed beach sand. It takes much more effort to move the boat over the softest beach sand on the east coast of Florida, but I expected that. The only thing that works best over this really soft sand is much bigger and more expensive wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Palin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Did a dry fit to see how best to secure kayak. Ended up using 4 of my own bungee cords, 2 around carrier frame and kayak & 2 from carrier frame to tie downs near middle of kayak. Kayak felt really secure while pulling it around driveway and grass. Carrier appears well made and the airless wheels are a plus. Hope to take kayak out soon to see how the carrier works at the lake. Would definitely recommend this carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Norm In NC

customer_reviews.title: Great price and did job very well
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about the few negative reviews, but at the price I was sure I could make it work. I got to the river this weekend and realized I had left the straps at home, so used some bungee cords instead. It worked fine even over some uneven terrain. In fact I am not sure I really needed the supplied straps. Construction is lightweight and strong and if you place it about half way between the seat and the stern it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon3D

customer_reviews.title: Great for moving kayaks around
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 kayaks including one heavy 2 person one. This little guy locks on and moves them all very well including over grass and sand. There were lots of comments on the wheels not needing inflation. The wheels are a pretty hard plastic that is styled after inflated tires. They seem very tough and never a flat! Sweet! My girls can move things around by themselves now so I'm in heavy like!
customer_reviews.author: Choglidite

customer_reviews.title: Collapses all the time. UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t like rough or bumpy terrain, will collapse if wheels hit any size obstacle. Only good on smooth surface. I use it with an inflatable kayak of 45 lbs. plus fishing gear and I am currently trying to modify the braces by adding some sort of locking pin so it won’t collapse while pulling. Other than that, it seems to be constructed of decent materials for the price. Good deal if you only need to transport your kayak over short distance with smooth terrain or pavement. Update: 9/15/19: Finally tightened each spring bolt so that the carrier will not collapse. But at least now it works for me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kuhlman

customer_reviews.title: Kayak rolls sidways and falls off
customer_reviews.text: Like- It is light weight, easy to set up. Don't like- with the straps provided, the kayak will turn sideways and flips the whole thing over while rolling. I tried tightening as much as I can, but the longer you pull it, it slowly rolls sideways. I can come up with a remedy, I'm sure, like threading through the scupper holes, but I was hoping for a cart that would just carry my kayak with no modifications.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great for Pulling Kayaks
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to get kayaks from our garage about half a mile to the lake. Once you figure out a good way to strap them on your boat so the straps stay in place, these carts making pulling the kayak easy. The big rubber wheels easily go over bumps and rocks. The carts also collapse easily and are lightweight so we can strap them to our kayaks while we are cruising around. Look no further if you want a well made kayak cart!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Straps are too slippery
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use the straps that came with the cart, but even when secured tightly according to the enclosed instructions, the straps slide off after a short time. Instead, I had to supply my own five-foot bungee cords to secure the kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Steven O.

customer_reviews.title: easier than carrying
customer_reviews.text: item goes together in minutes, takes up little room in van. would have given 5 stars but if you hit a larger bump on the way to the water it may fold up.
customer_reviews.author: Whisker

customer_reviews.title: SWEET RIDE !!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet ride for my kayak when I'm moving it from trailer to lake and back again. Only suggestion would be that I'd change the strap to a "ratchet" style and put some sort of "ring" for the strap to go through.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Cronin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This trolley is well built and the wheels are strong and solid. I transport a 16 ft canoe about 30 feet in and out of the lake ( we have a house on the lake ) and it is a piece of cake. Love the bungee cords that came with it as well as the strap. I leave the canoe on the trolley and there is no problem with the wheels distorting. Had to Send a TMS one back because the wheels fell apart after leaving the canoe on it overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Tbear

customer_reviews.title: Rolls easily on packed gravel and mowed grass
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help portage my kayak when a helper isn't available. it rolls ok on solid surfaces, but if the shoreline is muddy or soft, it would most likely get stuck, but then again, so would most wheels. The straps that came with it are way too long and take too much time to wrap and thread. I replaced them with long, thick bungie cords.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and store
customer_reviews.text: Used it a couple of times so far and I've got to say I'm shocked by the quality at the price. If it seems like it's not working for you, pick up the other end of the kayak. I don't think it's in the instructions, but depending on where it's positioned, there's a front and back. You'll get the idea right away; one end will just be easier.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Easy to fold. Light weight. Easy to load my kayak onto, and glides right along. I love this. I'm seriously thinking I need an extra one for my second kayak for when friends come along. It comes with a pulley strap, but I found it hard to operate, so I just use a bungee cord and it's perfect. I totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for inflatable kayak
customer_reviews.text: Well made, light in weight and very compatible with my inflatable kayak. Liked it so much we bought another for our second inflatable. The ratchets are a great feature. I did add a longer strap to reach the rachet from the other side. Easily enough done. The one supplied was too short. But otherwise, great performance.I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of carriers out there and they can get expensive. This Bonnlo is great - weighs very little and does not take up much space. Getting your kayak in the right position on the rack takes a little practice - but when it is on correctly it is so easy to maneuver! Very sturdy too!
customer_reviews.author: B McCann

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good Kayak Dolly, Not Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, and pretty good quality. Performs exactly as it should, once you find the sweet spot where you have to position it under you kayak. Happy Hauling
customer_reviews.author: Buckskin Bill

customer_reviews.title: It is easy and rolls on sand!
customer_reviews.text: I am not being paid or given this item for a positive review. This trailer ROCKS!!!! I moved from 1 block to the beach to 5 blocks. Carrying my board was wayyy to much. I purchased this bc a neighbor mentioned it. The straps took a minute for me to get. But after.. WoW! Fabulous! I walked 5 blocks and 6 blocks on WET SAND! I am a small girl.. very easy pull! Well worth every penny! I am stoked!!!!! Way Stoked!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: Great product and well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love the ratcheting straps!!! So much easier to tighten down the cart to my canoe or kayak, without slipping or moving around. Reasonably prices, great size of tires to run over roots from trees or running through the grass and the cart is very durable... overall Great Product and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The dolly works great, easy to use, folds up and can store on my sit on kayak. I really like the no flat tires, soooo much better than airing up and fixing pneumatic tires.
customer_reviews.author: bryan2103

customer_reviews.title: Great for my tandem
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I have a Lifetime made tandem kayak. I had been leaving it on the dock because I didn't want to drag it up to the house, but that meant I wasn't washing off the salt water. This makes it so easy that I don't mind taking my kayak up to the house and cleaning it up.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Sutherlin

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold my Old Town Topwater.
customer_reviews.text: May be fine for some yaks but will not hold my Old Town Topwater without it tipping over or falling off due to V shaped hull.
customer_reviews.author: Sharkman

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This cart is heavy duty and bulky but it is easy to pop the wheels off for storage. I have used it numerous times. I use a ratchet strap to attach the cart to my kayak when transporting. If you don't strap the cart to the kayak the kayak will slide off or the cart will not turn when you turn.
customer_reviews.author: frog

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and work well.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about these not having tires with air but my fears were groundless. These performed beautifully and are easy to use. The lake is about two blocks and down a hill and we got there with no issues. The cart kickstand actually can hold the entire end of the kayak off the ground if seated properly otherwise you have to be careful not to drag it. I have handles on each side of my kayak. All you have to do is push down on the side that is up and walk with the kayak. These carts are perfect even on grassy or rocky areas.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly G Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Does not carry kayaks well at all.
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly designed, stand keeps folding up while trying to carry a kayak. The platform is not suitable to mount a kayak so it keeps sliding off of it even after strapping the kayak down. Very disappointed with this. NOT RECOMMENDED FOR KAYAKS.
customer_reviews.author: boaz

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak cart!
customer_reviews.text: I should have taken a picture but I have yet to do so. However, I read all the reviews and my personal experience is that this cart is PERFECT! Follow the instruction and you won’t be disappointed. Even my 10 year old niece gets the kayak set up and drags it all over. She loves it to. I highly recommend getting one. I should have gotten one a long time ago. I would have been able to take my kayak to more places since you don’t have to carry it with this. Wheels are the best invention!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: We have a big 13.5'kayak & as long as we attach it between 1/2-1/3 towards the back it's fine. Obviously the further to the end it falls off. Turning can be tricky but if you have enough room to casually turn its much more stable. Makes moving a 90 lb kayak easier.
customer_reviews.author: debi1977

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.  terrible straps
customer_reviews.text: while these serve their purpose, the quality could be better. I bought two of these and the clamp that holds the kayak to the cart broke on the 1st use. In addition, these do not work with all kayaks. my Native kayak has drain holes that you can use for the straps, but this cart just slips and slides around.
customer_reviews.author: Rock

customer_reviews.title: Best kayak cart available
customer_reviews.text: Solid wheels! quality construction, great design, spring-loaded parts gently snap into place when folding and unfolding- a pleasant surprise as I did not expect this! it is lightweight, buy very sturdy and a cinch to fold for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kim T

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This is useless. The quality seems okay but the design of the cart makes it a terrible fit for strapping the kayak down. it will not stay secured regardless of the amount and tightness of strapping.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Todd Hawk

customer_reviews.title: This Kayak Cart makes kayaking so much easier.
customer_reviews.text: This cart works very well, easy to strap on , light weight....That being said, it may not last forever since I drag my kayak over some fairly big river rock, but if you don't pull it too fast, it works fabulously. I had to laugh when I noticed the (not for highway use) warning on the wheels...
customer_reviews.author: Dalesteraz@hotmail.com

customer_reviews.title: Too big to stow in sea kayaks, too expensive to return
customer_reviews.text: Double check the dimensions- this carrier is much larger than other options and significantly heavier. It is too large to stow in either of my sea kayak hatches and I really didn't feel like strapping it to the deck every time. Also check the return policy, with self ship it is more expensive for me to return than throw away. I also have the ABN universal kayak carrier which works like a champ and I just ordered another one to replace this Bonnlo carrier as it is not useful for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Cart Carrier
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to assemble. I would say if you are not familiar with ratchet straps, you should not get this. I had a real tough time using the straps correctly to secure it. It’s a little hard to maneuver it too.
customer_reviews.author: ReaderWoman

customer_reviews.title: Super deal if you have a kayak or canoe
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, came EARLY! well boxed and all parts included. Very sturdy, great price and looks nice. No more dragging your expensive boat around on its bu.. wheel. Wheels are not air inflated, so no flats ever to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: FLA SR

customer_reviews.title: Super for a kayak
customer_reviews.text: Pulling my 40lb kayak three blocks to the water with these wheels is practically as effortless as walking my dod. However, the 75lb canoe was a bit more of a challenge, and needed two people to pull. The only regret is these don't fold down to fit in the kayak hold, so I have to return to put-in each time. Not a big deal for my out-and-back use, but these are not the wheels you'd want to portage with you.
customer_reviews.author: Maria SG

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality kayak cart. Uniquely designed and well made. Difficult to assemble at first with the straps. Go to the video for help. The folding aspect is great. Small and compact. I’m very happy with it for my 12 foot kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Useful and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Good for transporting my kayak, and I use it to help load my kayak onto my van by strapping it upside down to my back window. I put the front of the kayak on the upturned wheels and roll it onto the van.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s not very wide
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my native slayer pro max and it’s difficult to keep it centered under the kayak. The cart is narrow and the kayak is wide. But for regular kayaks I’m sure it will be great
customer_reviews.author: Jonnyboy

customer_reviews.title: Great value works well
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I can now move my 17’ wooden canoe almost anywhere by myself. It did come undone some maneuvering over some 6” deadfall along a steep bank but if I strapped it down a little tighter it took the logs in stride and up we went. I leave it on until the water is deep enough and it’s clean then and easy to stash in the canoe broken down.
customer_reviews.author: "Carson"

customer_reviews.title: Love the airless tires!
customer_reviews.text: Did I mention the airless tires?! ;-) I had another, with red wheels and air tires, and the plastic wheel exploded the 1st time out. Luckily no one was injured
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Kayak Cart-Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Kayak cart, its very strong and very light, very easy to work on it under the Kayak, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joe DELAVEGA

customer_reviews.title: May or may not work for your kayak.
customer_reviews.text: Overall quality seems good. My only complaint is that for kayaks with a rather sharp V-shaped hull, the kayak won't rest securely in the carrier, but will rock to and fro and want to fall off. For a kayak with a flatter bottom, this carrier might work better.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Randall

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the wait!
customer_reviews.text: I love this dolly, I could find myself paying $80-$100 for a dolly from Bass Pro or Cabelas. I’ve purchase 2 of these kits and they’ve never failed me. They’re easy to set up, light weight, and look good! Shipping does take a good while; 2 weeks-ish - but besides that love them! 🤘🏼
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio Z

customer_reviews.title: Well built, but doesn't work well for me
customer_reviews.text: While this is a quality carrier, I found that it didn't hold very well and would slip off or flip around on bumpy terrain. As such, I don't use it much and just carry my kayak by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Caveman

customer_reviews.title: Works well when tied tightly
customer_reviews.text: This works great if you tie it tightly to the kayak. Otherwise, it falls off and is a bigger pain than just carrying the kayak itself. When it is tied properly, it works like a champ to carry kayaks!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hood

customer_reviews.title: Collapses on itself.
customer_reviews.text: I got the cart and immediately tried it out. At first I was thrilled, then hit a small bump and the entire cart collapsed. This is a huge issue. Trying to figure out how to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: awesome trolley over even ground.
customer_reviews.text: You should know, my use for this trolley is over a concrete boat ramp, NOT a rambunctious roll across uneven, overland woods, dirt, stumps, sticks, etc. I'm a disabled person, so I stick to the boat ramp. If your needs are to go overland, you should probably get some ratchet straps to hold your boat tightly to the trolley. On the boat ramp, this thing is sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for my 11 yr old granddaughter to carry her paddle board back and forth. She can load and secure the board to the cart by herself. She can pull it by herself. The cart maneuvers over fairly rough dirt road to the water and love the tires! Before making this purchase, she had to have help carrying it and even then had trouble because of the size and weight of the board. We both love it and recommend it. It also folds down for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: KathyF

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I'm 61 years old and my husband purchased 2 of these so we can transport our kayaks from the car to the water. Definitely recommend...we use two straps to fasten the kayak to the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, durable, not clumbsy, ez to use cart.
customer_reviews.text: This rugged, well designed kayak cart is ez to use, sturdy, well designed, great tires, will help you take your kayak anywhere, over bumpy trails or beaches, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H. Lubin

customer_reviews.title: Great cart, great price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cart! Worth every penny! Came complete with everything you need and handled two kayaks walking about 100 yards from parking lot to Riverside launch. Watch those quick release pins on the tires! I lost one already
customer_reviews.author: Miss Tina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, store and manuever
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 kayaks. This trolley makes it easy for us to move them from the back yard to the truck for hauling. It also works well rolling up boat ramps after a long day of floating. I recommend this trolley for kayak use.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Makes moving the kayak easy.
customer_reviews.text: Part of my bucket list was to go kayaking. So with the purchase of the trolley and some racks I am able to put both kayaks on my suv without a second person.
customer_reviews.author: tooretac

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: System doesn't work with all kayaks. Strap system doesn't work well with larger kayaks
customer_reviews.author: Kin San Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Great for kayakers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect removing The Kayaks around without having to drag them. I been looking around for something like this for a while and thos definitely the best for the price I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to assemble, works as intended, no issues. I don't use the included black straps (didn't even take out of the packaging), but instead use a ~2-3ft bungee cord to secure the kayaks as it seems a bit easier and quicker on/off to me. It takes all of 10 seconds to load the kayaks on, secure it, and off I go. Overall I'm very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We are new to Kayaking. We have inflatable kayaks, and really did need something to help us take the kayaks to the water. We used it in smooth and rough terrain. We were impressed with the job this little cart did. Easy to assemble, and sturdy enough!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This ended up being difficult to use. We couldn't figure out from the directions the best way to strap the kayak and no matter which way we strapped it, it began to slide as soon as we started pulling it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey M.

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: I substituted a 4 ft elastic cord for the straps and made it a little easier to tie up. This model is well made, easy to assemble and easy to use. I am a 70+ woman, too. Put the stern over the wheels, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Kohut

customer_reviews.title: A little hard to stabilize when getting kayak on, but once it’s on, it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of kayak wheels. The first had inflatable tires that did not last long (one exploded). I love that these tires are not pneumatic. Easy to roll on sand.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works Great.... The solid rubber tires are a excellent feature
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Waltman

customer_reviews.title: Great design and function.
customer_reviews.text: Great design, and makes hauling a kayak around perfectly. Fits perfectly in the back of my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Best Price Most Useabble
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a complicated, unstable, expensive Kayak cart with this sturdy, easy to tow at half the price. We love our carts!
customer_reviews.author: adel

product_meta.title: Bonnlo Kayak Cart Canoe Carrier Trolley with NO-Flat Airless Tires Wheels 2 Ratchet Straps Transport Jon Boat Dolly Tote
feature_bullets: CAPACITY: Generous 165lb carrying capacity allows you to easily transport your kayak / canoe;solid aluminium frame,and foam bumpers on each arm to protect your canoe / kayak hull; Rubber bumpers of the foot protect the frame from wearing
SOLID TIRES: No chemical smell,large full solid PU tires (10"D x 3"W),will roll smoothly across sand and gravel.
EASY ASSEMBLY AND DISASSEMBLY: Trolley is easy to assemble with no tools required;dolly breaks down for easy and convenient storage or transport.
SPRING LOADED STAND: Part of the support stand features a 12"H spring-loaded stand which keeps the dolly cart propped up onshore for quick loading out of water.
MORE ACCESSORIES: It will come with two 7.75 Ft (5TF+2.75) ratchet straps,you can secure full size kayak /canoe and yet store and transport the cart without any trouble..
